intro: Distylium pingpienense, commonly known as the Pingpien evergreen hollies, is a species of flowering plant in the family Caprifoliaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, blue-black berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
